alert.note: Alert for Escambia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 16 at 4:27AM EDT until June 16 at 6:15AM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR SOUTHERN BALDWIN AND SOUTH CENTRAL ESCAMBIA COUNTIES... At 327 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated that thunderstorms have moved to the south of the warned area. However earlier rounds of thunderstorms are estimated to have produced between 4 and 8 inches of rain with locally higher totals across much of south central Baldwin county and far southwestern Escambia county. Flash flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low lying areas is likely still ongoing. HAZARD...Thunderstorms producing life threatening flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Daphne, Robertsdale, Loxley, Lillian, Silverhill, Elsanor, Rosinton, Seminole, Belforest, Malbis, Perdido Heights, Paradise Beach and Pleasant Grove. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
